Name: Necklace of Psusennes The First
Description: This necklace is composed of two strings of large round beads, that are almost balls, with two gold ones in the center and forty six ones of lapis lazuli with beautiful colors varying from clear green to dark blue. It was found in the tomb of Psusennes the First.Another necklace almost identical to this one was also found in the tomb but smaller in size. This type of necklace is not Egyptian, on one of the lapis beads of the second necklace is engraved three parallel lines of cuneiform characters, which inform us that it was consecrated to the gods of Ashour by a high Assyrian dignitary for the life of his oldest daughter. It is not clear how the necklaces ended up in the possession of Psusennes the First.
